author: Dave Marien
comment: Good app but after last update I can't login. Says password isn't valid but password hasn't changed. Hopefully you can assist? Running android version 7+ and PRTG version 17+. Password field in PRTG app says it's using a "passhash"?  Contacted support, issue fixed now. Great app & good support. Thx.

reply.author: Paessler AG
reply.content: This is most likely an SSL problem. Please contact support@paessler.com and we'll help you fix it.

comment: Overall great app however latest upgrade hasn't stopped maps from loading due to (incorrectly reported) out of date browser which is a pain when using maps for oncall overview dashboard

author: Dave Butler
comment: Would be great if the push notification sound could have two sounds, a sad sound when service is down, and a happy sound when back up.  Right now you don't know if you should be happy or sad when the push comes.

I had originally rated this app a 1 star.  However, Stephan Linke with PRTG's support team was gracious and diligently worked with me to get this app working on my phone.  His efforts deserve 5 stars!

author: Imran Fida
comment: Everything worked till I restart the phone. After reboot, none of the widgets work. After adding new still doesn't work

author: Princess Leah
comment: Awesome app especially with the widgets and push notifications! Would have 5* easily if I could get rid of the 'PRTG notifications are enabled' from the android pull down menu. Really annoying since push works etc and I have set it to 99 hours. Any tips ?

author: doug roorda
comment: Works allot better then the desktop app,  but when adding a new server why would you make me retype the server name just because it cannot verify the password.  Pain in the a..

author: Eng Amer
comment: Thanks it is powerful tools

author: DutchBoy
comment: Works great, but I would love to see a feature where I can make 'notification rules' to get different notifications based on priority or other sensor variables. For example a high priority sensor might overrule silent mode with only vibration or including sound. A low prority sensor might only show a notification without sound or vibration.

author: Dan Fokin
comment: Very good, but could you remove prtg tools from default installation package?

author: Ali Khanari
comment: Top3 for monitoring

author: Martijn van Weert
comment: The app works well with out prtg servers.  There is only one major issue with the widget. When the widget is unable to contact the server or login (because of a password change or otherwise) it doesn't show this on the widget and just proceed to show the last status. This is misleading and therefore not good. It should show a warning that there was a problem contacting the server.

PRTG is a beautiful, well-written Network Diagnostic App. If you are a Network Analyst or Manager, IT Support, or just fine-tuning your own system, Install PRTG. This is a brilliant Network Information Manager, and comprehensive diagnostic tool. Not just for professionals.
It is incredibly rich and fleshed out. Terrific. I feel Empowered.
Excellent all around.

author: Viktor Kalivoda
comment: Just great. :)

comment: Really nice up for monitoring

comment: Good

comment: With the help of support it is working again on Android Nougat

comment: Excellent app, easy to use, comprehensive feature support. Would have liked better offsite access to one's server but that is something one can work around for now.

comment: Been using PRTG Droid for over 2 years never crashes no errors Paessler does it right!
title: PRTG ROCKS!

comment: With this application i can monitor my network remotely, maybe you can add in the app for notification config for devices/sensor. But overall the apps is rocking...

comment: We are able to monitor our Apps,DBm and devices remotely during the week or weekend and whilst travelling. Works perfectly.

comment: Use it nearly every day to manage alerts at work. It is much faster now and looks great too.

comment: Love the push notifications.
title: Works like a charm!

author: James Tuson
comment: I really like how they list the permissions used and give reasons. App works well but seems a [edit: recent update made this a lot faster] bit slow to load each section [no longer the case]. Would like to have widgets for specific sensors. If that was possible would give 10 stars out of 5.
title: Works, I like the permissions explanation

author: Steve Allen
comment: Great app and it keeps getting be with every update.
title: Keeps getting better

author: Vinhxc Trinh Thanh
comment: I hope this app will have the function to push the notification each time the sensor went down
title: Requires lot of data

author: Mike Barnes
comment: PRTG is an essential part of an IT admin's toolbox. Having the app on my phone makes keeping tabs on the systems I manage much more convenient. Maybe that's a bad thing - lol. Suggestions... selecting multiple sensors at once so I can pause/acknowledge them all quickly would be very helpful. Also, the comment field when pausing/acking a sensor shouldn't be required, I never use it. Maybe add a check box for 'Add comment' to the pause time duration selector would be a good solution.
title: Great software, great app
